segments.text: Hello everyone, this is a video presentation for a product that is not alone.
We are team uncomplicated.
And this we are basically a team of three people who are very passionate about AI.
My name is Hiram Chandla and I'm a machine learning engineer at Simplified.
And we have Ishan Dutta who is a deep learning researcher at TreeFace.
And we have Vatsal Sakaria who is a front end intern at Toddlab.
Now why did we even build Not Alone?
That was the reason that we came up with it.
So we often saw that people with dyslexia often find it hard to, you know, just read
and write.
Primarily because, you know, in an interview, we saw someone talking that it's hard for
them to mentally lock in onto a word or particular sentence.
So that's how the idea just popped out.
Like, we just thought, like, what could we do to help them get better at reading or writing?
So we started doing some research and we found that it's often easier for them to read on
electronic devices rather than reading the real document itself.
And that's something that became the foundation of our whole product.
So some key points that we wanted to address.
First is we wanted to help them read better.
And in order to do that, we had to build a UI that is especially helpful for dyslexic
people to read.
Now second is we wanted them to write better.
Now what we saw after researching is that dyslexic people often use some third party
ESL service that would help them write instead of, you know, just having them type out a
sentence.
They can just talk, speak into it and it will type about it.
Now third is assisted writing.
Now you have a text generated out of ESL or some service.
You want to enhance that text.
And this is why we built some out of the box features using chat GPT, which could help
you enhance the quality of your text.
Fourth is a helping hand.
Now dyslexic people often have some sort of guide, a sort of a guide that is with them
helping them out.
But what if you don't have that?
What if you feel lost at some point?
And that's why we have a customized chatbot provided to you with which you can interact
and find solutions to basic problems that you feel are there.
Now what was our solution to this?
Now to make them read better, we had a text to speech service integrated so whenever they
feel stuck at reading at some point, all they can do is just click on that word and say
read for me and it will speak out that word for you.
And second is writing with assistance.
So as I said, we have some out of the box feature.
All you need to do is select the text and let it know what you want to do.
And all this is done in a single click, you want to rewrite, you want to enhance the quality
of your word, you want this paragraph to be summarized or something and it will do that
for you.
Along with that, we have a speech to text service that allows you to, that helps you
write by just speaking into it.
Now how is all this done?
We have Whisper, so for speech to text, we are using Whisper.
And for text writing assistance, we are using ChatGPT, we have many prompts and many services
like grammar correction, rewriting, summarization, etc. which you can use to enhance the quality
of your text.
And third is a text to speech service, which is basically done using a Chrome service.
And whenever you feel stuck at reading, just select the word and yeah, it will help you
understand like, it will help you listen to what that word is.
Now what are the features that we provide?
So the first feature that we have is custom font.
Now as I said, we did a lot of research when it came to building some sort of UI that could
be of extreme help for dyslexic people.
So we have a font called as Open Dyslexia, Open Dyslexia font, which helps them, you
know, help them read better.
Second, is a customizable reading environment.
Now what we saw is line height and word spacing is of extreme help when it comes to dyslexic
people.
So we have a customizable environment that could help them adjust based on the optimal
ratio that we found for dyslexic people.
Now third is visual adjustment.
We saw that contrast is of immense importance to dyslexic people.
White often hinders them.
So we have a dark mode by default for our application that could help them read better.
Now what are the features that we provide?
So first is write anything.
You just say, write about X topic and it will write it for you.
You can ask it, what does a paragraph mean?
Math is often hard to understand.
You can just say simplify and it will generate an explanation, simple explanation for you.
Third is rewriting.
You know, you wrote a paragraph, you don't really like it.
You say rewrite it for me and it will do so for you.
Fourth is summarize.
Sometimes paragraphs are too big to even read.
So you can just select it and summarize it, say summarize and it will do so for you.
Fifth is proxy writer.
You start writing and in mid you're like, okay, what now?
So you can just expand the text and it will do so for you.
Sixth is thesaurus.
You can replace some words with the suggestions that the, with the suggestions chat GPT provides
you and yeah, you can make your, make a paragraph or text look better.
Now we have talked a lot about how this is and what it does, but let's see what, how
this, how our product looks like actually.
So it's developed over Vercel so you can take a demo with there.
And yeah, like as you can see, it's in dark mode by default, which is optimal for people
with dyslexia, but I am a light person so I can just switch it to light mode and yeah,
let's start by writing.
This is the default editor interface.
So yeah, let's start by telling it, let's say I want to write some paragraph about medical
industry and AI.
Write a paragraph about impact of AI in medical industry.
And this is the speech to text service that we have.
And now we have a text that we spoke here.
Now let's say I want to expand it.
I select it.
And as you can see, this is the selected text we have and say expand this text.
After processing this, it will write a full-fledged paragraph for you.
It will have introduction.
It will have core message, motivation, and finally a conclusion itself.
So this is the paragraph that we have.
Starts with an introduction, builds into the problem, and then goes on to the conclusion
bit.
Now as you can see, we have a paragraph with us, but let's say some word is often hard
for us to understand, right?
So what does revolutionize even mean?
So we'll just say explain text.
And after processing for a while, it will generate the whole information on revolutionize
for us.
Now if, let's say we have a sentence that we, like, or a word, maybe, we just want to
get a synonym.
We just say synonym.
And we got a solution for that.
Now let's say some word is often hard for us to pronounce.
So let's say potentially is hard for me to understand.
So speak text.
And it spoke for me.
Now let's say there's a big paragraph.
Let's say this one only.
And you ask it to summarize.
It will summarize it for you.
After processing it for a while, it summarizes the whole paragraph.
Now let's say you want this paragraph to be rewritten.
So you rewrite it.
And it rewrites the paragraph for you.
Now you can also, as I said, like, you can, this is the open dyslexia font that is optimal
for user, but you can also switch the font to something to enter, which is an alternate
of Helvetica, another font, which is often found really good for people with dyslexia.
Now as you can see, you can adjust the spacing between the words so that it's often easier
for the user to just read it.
And there you go.
Now you have your paragraph.
You just want to save it.
And there you go.
You can save your paragraph here in form of PDF.
There you go.
You can edit this heading, MEDINDUSTRY and AI.
There you go.
You have a full-fledged document with you.
Now let's say you are just lost and you just want someone to talk to.
So you just go here, a chat-based window, which is also based on chat.jpd.
And you say, how to make friends.
And once you send it, it will basically list down all the steps for you on how to make
friends.
And all this is done by chat.jpd.
And as you can see, it generated a bunch of text to answer your query.
And like this, you can ask a lot of questions to it.
Now this is our prototype for Not Alone, but we have big plans for our product.
So let's see what they are.
So first is community access.
Now talking with chat bot is well and good, but having some person listen to your queries
and help you is a different feeling itself.
So we want a community of people that could help such people in any sort of manner.
Second is URL-based content summarization.
Now obviously, you can go over to a website, copy it, and paste it on the editor, and summarize,
and it will summarize it for you.
But let's say you don't want to do that.
Some sites are really complicated to get text out of.
So you just copy the URL, paste it, and it will generate a summary for you.
And that's another thing that we want to add in our application in the future.
Third is document parsing.
So electronic displays help you read easier.
So why not just bring everything onto there?
We can have a feature like you can just input an image, and it will parse the document on
itself and convert all the handwritten notes or something into a PDF format or electronic
record format.
Fourth is access to opportunities.
Now we find that dyslexic people are immensely intelligent.
And it's also seen that their intellectual level is on the same level as that of someone
without dyslexia.
They have a lot of abilities.
They have a lot of creativity.
But their achievement is often limited due to their ability, due to their condition.
They have creative minds, but they're unable to express themselves when it comes to writing
or anything.
So we can have some sort of freelancing opportunities or training opportunities on board to help
them improve and maybe earn as well.
Thanks a lot.
That was all.
This was our product, Not Alone.
Hope you liked it.
Thanks for giving us an opportunity to collaborate together over this.
Thank you.
